listing.title: Laravel / jQuery / MVC PHP Developer
listing.description:
Laravel / jQuery / MVC PHP Developer

We're a startup looking to develop a strong SaaS product for several hire industries. Our product is going to revolutonise the management of hire businesses in several sectors including: lighting & sound, AV, plant hire, marquees and many more.

At the moment we're looking for an experienced freelance developer who can lead development in our product, help shape our roadmap and bring our ideas to life.

Working alongside the Directors and a UI designer, you can work remotely (EU/USA) or join us in our Norfolk office - the choice is yours. Our team is spread across the UK, and we won't mind what hours you keep. We don't micro manage, we'll simply assign tickets and expect to see efficient progress.

Experience:

  • PHP MVC OOP (Laravel 3/4, CodeIgniter)
  • MySQL / Git / jQuery & AJAX
  • Understanding of HTML, CSS etc
  • Previously experience with:
  • Subscription and billing systems for web apps
  • Complex calendaring systems
  • Item inventories with sub-items and several pricing scenairos

Bonus:

  • Knowledge of Stripe API
  • iPhone/iPad/Android dev experience
  • Scaling & growth of infrastructure / nix knowledge
  • Deployment / cloud infrastructure
  • Ready to start in May/June 2013
  • SaaS/Startup/Web App experience

Next Steps:
  • List of three web applications you've worked on, with URLs
  • Your current availability and daily/hourly rate
  • GitHub, code samples and anything that sells you

Hirely is being created by a small web agency in Diss, Norfolk - mdkwebmedia. We're small team mainly developing web projects for the arts sector.


NO AGENCIES PLEASE

listing.title: XHTML/CSS Guru with PHP, Javascript & jQuery Knowledge WANTED ASAP
listing.description:
We are seeking an experienced front-end developer (XHTML/CSS) with PHP, and Javascript/jQuery knowledge.

We have our own proprietary CMS (based off of Codeigniter) which always needs new "themes" and "modules".

We need someone to take PSD files, slice them into XHTML/CSS and then program them using PHP,/jQuery into our own CMS (codeigniter).

We have hundreds of projects and extensive room for growth so if you are a ROCK STAR developer and you are looking for a fast growing company where you can work your own hours and be utilized to your fullest potential, then this job is for you.

If you are a web development company - DO NOT APPLY. This opportunity is for freelance developers only.

Thank you!
listing.howto_apply: You must include portfolio or samples of your work which show that you are a fully capable. UI/UX usability, CSS, PHP, jQuery/Ajax proficiency is a MUST. Thank you!

listing.title: UI + Graphic Design
listing.description:
Looking for someone with a little flare that has a good mix of traditional & technical design skills. They must have experience in designing mobile + broadband UI as well as have the ability to tie in traditional aspects like digital slicks for product releases and media. The type of work we produce is missing the uniqueness that we deliver via code as an innovation product partner.

When responding, don't just send a list of websites, please send a digital portfolio (pdf or microwebsite prefered) that portrays all aspects of your skill sets. You must have an expert level of manipulating Adobe Create Suite 5/6 and know how to manipulate creatives into working vector/web assets for mobile and broadband websites.

Skills & Requirements

  • Internet: web and email design including headers, buttons, backgrounds, iconography, typography

  • Mobile: design in iOS, Android, and/or mobile web

  • Produce design boards and page requirements

  • Tech: slice and annotate designs for use by tech team in development

  • UX/UI: design software products and assets from scratch using strong UX/UI insight

Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of web site structure and functionality including HTML/CSS

  • Solid knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver

  • Strong design style, including creative design solutions within the constraints of the Internet

  • Strong conceptual skills, including online software concepts and online experience concepts

  • Familiarity with user experience best practices with regard to web, mobile and responsive design

  • Familiarity with Internet design best practices with regard to compatibility, accessibility, loading, etc.

  • Familiarity with web accessibility, maintainability, and organic search optimization

  • Self-motivated to prioritize and manage work load and meet critical project milestones and deadlines

  • A passion for trends in web and mobile design

  • Must be enthusiastic, dedicated, and able to meet tight deadlines

Also a Plus:

  • Knowledge of SaSS

  • Some working knowledge of jQuery

listing.title: Back End PHP Developer to Work with Mobile App Dev Studio
listing.description:
Blue Whale Apps is an iOS app development studio headquartered in South Florida with an amazing work environment and corporate culture. We are searching for a Senior back end PHP developer with at least 4 years experience.

You will work closely with our iOS developers to build CMS features including the creation and integration of custom and third-party APIs.

You will have the ability to review and optimize legacy code as we often have to clean up sloppy coding from previous projects we may inherit and show our strengths.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Familiarity with developing APIs for mobile apps is a must.  
  • PHP (Object-Oriented)
  • MYSQL
  • Linux Server Administration (don't have to be an expert. have to be able to get stuff done.)
  • Social network API and Plugins skills
  • Experience in RESTful HTTP API development is desirable
  • JavaScript (+jQuery)
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • Great communication skills and excellent ability to solve problems
  • Good time management skills and ability to meet project deadlines
  • Offer recommendations for solutions and collaborate with team on project effort and estimates.

listing.title: Freelance Designer
listing.description:
FREELANCE DESIGNER (NEW YORK)

CREATETHE GROUP is seeking a stellar freelance digital designer, junior/mid/senior, to support our busy team in New York.

The freelance designer is responsible for supporting the visual design and user experience teams, by executing digital concepts from discovery to detailed design. This is a hands-on, occasional client-facing role that executes the evolution of an original concept. The candidate will have the ability to understand the unique challenges of our high touch clients; from luxury, fashion, beauty, hospitality and premium consumer packaged goods. The candidate will also be nimble enough to switch from one to the other without missing a mark, and is brave enough to think different while maintaining the highest standards of design usability. We’re looking for a detail obsessed, creative thinker and doer who thrive in a collaborative, fast paced environment. The freelance designer reports into the Art Directors, Creative Director and Chief Creative Officer.

The freelance designer candidate qualifications:

•       2+ years of digital/interactive experience in design, creating large scale websites, digital campaigns, applications

•       A strong understanding of grid systems, responsive design systems, and an impeccable sense of typography and graphic design

•       A conceptual thinker that can execute and articulate their vision from concept to production

•       A natural storyteller with stellar communication and presentation skills

•       A creative who’s a geek at heart, lives for emerging technologies, and is hungry to keep learning

•       Their passion is bigger than their ego, a team player

•       Photography, copywriting, coding or motion graphics skills a bonus

•       Lives life through an artful lens and appreciates a good laugh

**This is an on site position and requires local candidates

CREATETHE GROUP is a collective of agile, open-minded thinkers, who are passionate about everything we do and pride ourselves in our open and forward thinking approach. We foster a collaborative, fun-loving environment and encourage an inventive spirit.  We’re looking for like-minded people who can help us grow, inspire and learn from each other.

listing.title: Web Developer  - Back-End + Wordpress
listing.description:
SemiBig Creative Industries is a boutique agency based in the San Francisco East Bay area. We work with Fortune 500 companies and start-ups to craft intuitive and visually-rich experiences for their web applications, software, and mobile systems—resulting in award-winning creative campaigns for brands such as Intuit, Cisco, Apple, and HP.

Our creative process includes iterative design, interactive prototypes and user testing to meet the brand, marketing, and development goals for our clients. We are there to support, extend, and enhance their brand vision—or help them develop one.

OVERVIEW

We are seeking a skilled Web Developer with excellent communication skills to assist our other developer with ongoing efforts on a freelance basis. Our ideal candidate is very organized, flexible, willing to offer strong positions on strategies and has a decent sense of humor. While being able to write clean markup is necessary, the top requirement for this role is solid back-end engineering skills.

We offer Wordpress-based CMS solutions for our clients that always demand a great deal of extending the platform to meet individualized needs. We need someone who will search for and utilize the best tools to meet the requirements, will try to see if pre-built solutions like plugins fit the bill first, but will have no problem building the functionality from scratch if it doesn't already exist while considering security and performance. This person can work from anywhere with flexibility in schedule, but will need to be available on occasion for meetings during PST time. Big bonus if you're in the SF Bay or San Diego area!

RESPONSIBILITIES

Work closely with our other developer to build Wordpress CMS features including the integration of third-party APIs. Offer recommendations for solutions. Develop new deployment and automation strategies (deploy scripts, cron jobs, etc). Support in general server administration. Collaborate with team on time estimates. Advocate best practices for ongoing challenges such as Wordpress security. Bring new ideas to the table and help us improve our internal processes.

REQUIREMENTS

You have to be really good with this stuff:

  • PHP (Object-Oriented)
  • MYSQL
  • Linux Server Administration (don't have to be an expert. have to be able to get stuff done.)
  • Wordpress
  • JavaScript (+jQuery)
  • HTML
  • CSS
  • Google Analytics
  • Experience Integrating Third-Party APIs into Wordpress (on the front-end and the WP Admin)

If you have experience with this stuff, that's even better:
  • Marketing Automation Platforms
  • HighCharts
  • Wordpress running on Nginx
  • eCommerce
  • SASS
  • LESS
  • CoffeeScript
  • Git
  • RequireJS
  • Ruby
  • Postgres

If this sounds fun, please send us a link to your site (if you have one), work samples, why you want to work with us and your hourly rate.

listing.title: Front End Developer & Designer
listing.description:
We're Growing Are You?

We're looking for a talented front end developer & designer with a strong desire to produce the highest quality results and the ability to work well with fellow creatives.

If that’s you, then you could find yourself working alongside a team of some of the best designers and developers in the business, working on projects used by some of the top brands, including HP, Mazda, Electronic Arts and Under Armour.


About us:

The Buzz is a young, forward thinking digital agency and everyone has a substantial impact on our success. 

Whilst we encourage an office presence where possible, we're a modern thinking company, fully aware that the best talent is not always the nearest talent. This position allows you to work from home or the local coffee shop… and you'll have flexible hours. 

Deadlines are vital to our business but your working hours are not. We’re not rigidly stuck in a 9-5 routine. Our geographical spread of both staff and clients won’t allow it.
 

What you'll do:

You'll balance form and function to push the limits of what can be done on the web and work on anything from beautiful image composites to detailed interfaces.

As a member of the creative team, you'll be working directly with award-winning creative directors, art directors, copywriters, and user experience designers.

You will work hard for our clients and for our agency and will be expected to consistently improve and learn. 

In addition to creating beautiful, user-friendly designs for our clients, personal projects are both encouraged and supported by your fellow employees as we help you develop professionally.
 

This isn't for:

The faint of heart. We have an aggressive product roadmap that we have committed to delivering to our clients and partners. If you’re not afraid of hard work and thrive on trying to do the impossible, then keep reading.

Those requiring lots of direction and supervision. You need to take initial direction on a project and then bring it to life, knowing that you'll get it down accurately, thoroughly and on time.

Those looking for temporary help, this is a long-term position with huge growth opportunity. If you're the right person, we'll want to invest in in you and we want you to be with us for a long time.


What we expect:


Qualifications

Bachelors degree preferred, preferably in Business, Engineering, or related field.
 

Skills

Minimum 2 years experience designing for the web in a professional background

Mastery of Photoshop and Illustrator

Knowledge of Wordpress

Experience with wireframe/prototype software

Ability to design mastery level Web 2.0 styled work with fast deadlines

Ability to deliver a vast portfolio of works with your resume

Knowledge of Google analytics 

User Interface Experience

HTML/CSS & JS coding skills

Ability to turn PSD's into clean coded HTML & Wordpress themes

Unparalleled attention to detail

A passionate curiosity about web and technology trends.


How to Apply:
 
Email job@thebuzz.co.uk with your full name and date as the subject.

Be sure to include your Resume, Portfolio and Social Profiles (Linked In, Twitter & Facebook).

listing.title: Project Manager
listing.description:
We are Advant Interactive, a group of design and developer nerds. We're a small bunch so far but we have plans for world domination.  We're based in Venice, just a Kobe 3-pointer from the beach, and a taxi ride from the heart of LA.  We are on the lookout for an individual who seeks a position at the cutting edge of web development.  All candidates must work with speed and enjoy sweating over tight deadlines.

Who are you?

The dude (or dudette) for the role should have a minimum of 1-2 years in the world of web development with prior history in project management. You are outrageously organized - color-coding, folders and systems are the stuff of dreams.

You also love people - you’re a natural mentor and sounding board and knowing that you helped someone else succeed gives you enormous satisfaction. You love coaching people to do their best, seeing people’s strengths and talents and drawing it out of them even more.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Managing schedules, budgets, assets, and overall project organization to ensure requirements and project deliverables dates are clearly communicated, understood, and executed

  • Monitoring daily activities of the project team to ensure work progresses as planned

  • Manage client expectations to ensure delivery of the highest quality service

  • Collecting and acting on client feedback

TECH SAVVINESS

  • Basic HTML knowledge - know how to manipulate a few lines of HTML in Dreamweaver

  • Some Photoshop experience - cropping, file size optimization, etc.

  • CMS experience - WordPress/ Joomla, etc.

  • BONUS - Working knowledge of SEO basics

And it goes without saying...

  • You can both talk the talk and walk the walk

  • You have 20:20 vision when it comes to fine details

  • You consider missing a deadline one of the seven deadly sins


If you've gotten this far, you could be just what we're looking for.  Send us your resume and portfolio and we'll talk.
